product_description: FIBEROCK® Aqua-Tough™ paperless gypsum fibre board

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

recyclable_percentage_description: Generally gypsum board may be reprocessed into soil conditioner for agricultural and civil works applications
recyclable_offcuts_description: Using Fiberock interior linings can reduce site waste. This is due to the ability with Fiberock to reuse off-cuts during installation; machining in extra tapers to off-cuts as needed.
recycling_process_description: Generally gypsum board may be reprocessed into soil conditioner for agricultural and civil works applications
reusable_description: Fiberock linings can be demounted and recovered during demolition, and then be reused again on another structure. Fiberock linings after demounting can have new edge tapers machined in, making reuse achieveable.
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Products loading on the truck for distribution is maximised and optimised for delivery through our large national distribution network to ensure products leaving the gate to site distance is minimised
minimisation_design_strategy: Using Fiberock interior linings can reduce site waste. This is due to the ability with Fiberock to reuse off-cuts during installation; machining in extra tapers to off-cuts as needed.
specific_installation_methods: Fiberock linings can be demounted and recovered during demolition, and then be reused again on another structure. Fiberock linings after demounting can have new edge tapers machined in, making reuse achievable.
applied_finish_required_description: Paint system, tiles, vinyl, wall paper, laminates, lead
other_comments: Knauf has embraced this challenge with the ambition to become an industry leader in sustainable construction. Our goal is to reach net-zero by 2045 – five years ahead of the Paris agreement. And when Knauf turns 100 in 2034, we will have cut directly controlled CO2 emissions in half.
type_of_packaging: Fiberock packaging consists of cardboard edge protectors and wooden pallets for ship freight from the USA.  The products distributed to construction sites in Australia do not have packaging, products sits on plasterboard billets and strapped down for transport.

product_code: Various widths, lengths and edge profiles
product_description: Lightweight two-in-one application plasterboard for residential walls and ceilings

product_categories.category_name: Internal Wall Linings, finishes and partition systems

recyclable_percentage_description: Generally plasterboard may be reprocessed into soil conditioner for agricultural and civil works applications by third party
recyclable_offcuts_description: Generally plasterboard may be reprocessed into soil conditioner for agricultural and civil works applications by third party
recycling_process_description: Generally plasterboard may be reprocessed into soil conditioner for agricultural and civil works applications by third party
reusable_description: Plasterboard may be demountable if designed into projects specifications
water_reduction_techniques: Recycled water or rainwater plant dependent
transport_emissions_minimisation_techniq: Products loading on the truck for distribution is maximised and optimised for delivery through our large national distribution network to ensure products leaving the gate to site distance is minimised
minimisation_design_strategy: Height and spacing of studs to correlate with standard full sheet sizes for optimised installation and waste
applied_finish_required_description: Paint system, tiles, vinyl, wall paper, laminates, lead

Our goal is to reach net-zero by 2045 – five years ahead of the Paris agreement. And when Knauf turns 100 in 2034, we will have cut directly controlled CO2 emissions in half.
